citations.narrative:
The facility has 4 cage carpets that are being used as whelping mats for the dogs that are excessively worn and have
frayed edges. One whelping divider had excessive chew damage along the entire top edge. There are 4 outdoor runs that
have chew damage present on the polyurethane steps. Chew damage in these areas can not be properly cleaned and
sanitized and can cause sharp edges that can injure the dogs. Cage carpets with frayed edges can be ingested by the
dogs or can cause entrapment of a limb. Correct by ensuring that all surfaces of the housing facility including houses,
dens, and other furniture type fixtures and objects within the facility that can not be readily cleaned and sanitized are
repaired or replaced when worn or soiled.

The facility does not have a written and approved exercise plan that is being followed. Failure to document and follow a
written and veterinarian approved exercise plan does not allow for APHIS officials to determine if an appropriate protocol
has been followed. Correct by ensuring that a written and veterinarian approved exercise plan is documented and
followed.

The facility has not conducted fecal testing or heartworm testing on any of the dogs. Failure to provide sampling and
treatment of parasites and other pests in the dogs can lead to a delay in detection and treatment. Correct by ensuring that
sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests in accordance with a schedule approved by the attending
veterinarian is documented and followed.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A" license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by April 15, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
Additional Inspectors:
Lauren Murphy, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
